title: Neurospirituality - The Science of Religious Experience
author: punicwax / Van Kush Family
overview: Non-denominational religious philosophy that God impacts the brain in scientifically measurable ways, replicable through sacrament or eucharist

core_definition.compatibility: Can be held by member of any or all religions
core_definition.thesis: God impacts the brain in ways visible to human science, and this can be replicated by Sacrament or Eucharist

sacrament_quote.source: 'The Sacramentals: What are they?' by Regina Doman
sacrament_quote.text: There is a part of us that longs for something tangible [that reminds us of, and connects us to God, Grace, & Spirit], that interacts with the senses. The sacraments, those sacred mixtures of matter and the Holy Spirit, fulfill that need.

implications.religious: Validates religious experiences through scientific observation
implications.scientific: Provides measurable framework for spiritual phenomena
implications.practical: Sacraments and eucharist can produce replicable spiritual experiences

related_concepts.entheogen: Substance that generates the divine within

quiz_questions.a: Non-denominational philosophy that God impacts the brain in scientifically measurable ways, replicable through sacrament
quiz_questions.explanation: Compatible with any religion - bridges science and spirituality

quiz_questions.q: According to the sacramentals quote, what do sacraments fulfill?
quiz_questions.a: The human need for something tangible that interacts with the senses and connects us to God, Grace, & Spirit
quiz_questions.explanation: Sacred mixtures of matter and Holy Spirit
